work.summary: Corrector for the 4th year undergraduate Introduction to Data Science course (CSI 4142).
highlights: Correcting assignments, midterm and final project.
Presenting a lecture on the entire lifecycle (data → data cube → data mining).

work.summary: Developed new features, maintained code, fixed bugs, participated in code review and quality assurance testing.
highlights: Designed, architected and developed a proof of concept for a new core feature, allowing users to manage their network connections from within a diagram, and a projects' bill of materials.
Increased developer productivity by streamlining the code review process.
Improved performance and response time by up to 50% after discovering and fixing numerous N+1 queries.

work.summary: Designed, architected, and developed a web service to integrate with the parliament's financial system as well as an interactive phishing quiz.
highlights: Designed, developed and documented a web service, database, and dashboard for monitoring logs of the in-house financial system.
Designed, architected and developed a single page application for cyber-security awereness month.

work.summary: Developed an administration panel for low memory linux touchscreen Point Of Sale mini kiosks, that runs in custom-built WebKit QT browser.
highlights: Kiosks were used in brick-and-mortar stores to sell tickets to events including the Ottawa Jazz Festival, for which attendance averages around 300 000.

work.summary: Improved and maintained a .NET web application.
highlights: Single-handedly maintained the core reviewing tool for 6 weeks.
Discovered and co-fixed issues in production data that could have led to legal liabilities for employer.
Refactored a report and achieved over 50% speedup in part due to better SQL queries.
Resolved 85% of bugs and features in the product backlog.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered over the years as a developer, ticket scanning supervisor, barback, cashier, and bartender
highlights: Created a website to allow new volunteers to sign up.
Optimizing the gate setup for ticket scanning, closing the park, scanning troubleshooting, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
Worked in the VIP tent. Duties included: barback, bartender, admissions, cashier, setting up tent space.

education.summary: Thesis-based masters, admitted with a total of $35k in scholarships and grants. Published a thesis and two papers.
Took part in the co-operative education program, leading to 4 four-month internships over the course of the diploma.
Obtained the French Baccalaureate in the scientific section with a specialization in Mathematics from the French Academy of Caen. Attended high school at the Lycée Claudel in Ottawa.

publications.name: Soft Voting Windowing Ensembles for Learning from Partially Labelled Streams
publications.summary: Short-form paper from thesis research, showcased at the ECML PKDD nfCMP 2019 workshop.

publications.name: Semi-Supervised Hybrid Windowing Ensembles for Learning from Evolving Streams
publications.summary: Developed an ensemble machine-learning algorithm that was roughly 160 times faster than current state of the art techniques, and achieved comparable predictive accuracy. Contributions include:
highlights: a novel windowing approach for ensembles
extending a drift detector to work without any labelled data
a weighted soft voting scheme for ensembles
and investigating the limits of non-selective self-training.

publications.name: An Exploratory Study of Oral and Dental Health in Canada
publications.summary: Published a paper at the ICMLA 2017 conference with 2 other students, under the supervision of Dr. Herna Viktor. This paper is the result of a graduate level directed studies course on data warehousing.
highlights: Acquired data from the Canadian Community Health Survey provided by Statistics Canada.
Used R, Python and Microsoft's ETL suite to build a data cube according to Kimball's data warehouse lifecycle framework.
Performed an exploratory analysis of the data using WEKA's data mining tools.
Presented our work, results and findings at the end of the semester in a presentation and report.

projects.name: Jazzify
projects.summary: Created a website to allow new volunteers to sign up.
highlights: Used for five consecutive years to recruit new volunteers.
Thousands of sign ups.

projects.name: Personal website
projects.summary: Personal website to publish my CV and travel blog.

projects.name: An Active Learning System for Text Classification
projects.summary: Implemented a proof-of-concept for an online active-learner to handle text-classification for the undergraduate honours project.
highlights: Implemented a web interface for an active learning classifier
Researched state of the art techniques for text classification
Researched approaches to improve accuracy while reducing the required quantity of labeled records
Wrote a project report
Presented our work, results and findings at the end of the semester
